sentence1: He discovered the use of fire, and succeeding generations learned from him to cook their food.
sentence2: Hence his descendants were intrusted with the preservation of fire, while he himself was made the Fire-God.

sentence1: Hence his descendants were intrusted with the preservation of fire, while he himself was made the Fire-God.
sentence2: He is a personification of the Red Lord, who showed himself at the beginning of the world as one of the Five Ancients.

sentence1: He is a personification of the Red Lord, who showed himself at the beginning of the world as one of the Five Ancients.
sentence2: The Fire-God is worshiped as the Lord of the Holy Southern Mountain.

sentence1: The Fire-God is worshiped as the Lord of the Holy Southern Mountain.
sentence2: In the land of the four rivers there dwelt a man who was very rich.

sentence1: In the land of the four rivers there dwelt a man who was very rich.
sentence2: One day he got into his wagon and set out on a long journey.

sentence1: One day he got into his wagon and set out on a long journey.
sentence2: And he met a girl, dressed in red, who begged him to take her with him.

sentence1: And he met a girl, dressed in red, who begged him to take her with him.
sentence2: He allowed her to get into the wagon, and drove along for half-a-day without even looking in her direction.

sentence1: He allowed her to get into the wagon, and drove along for half-a-day without even looking in her direction.
sentence2: Then the girl got out again and said in farewell: "You are truly a good and honest man, and for that reason I must tell you the truth.

sentence1: Then the girl got out again and said in farewell: "You are truly a good and honest man, and for that reason I must tell you the truth.
sentence2: Hurry home at once to arrange your affairs and save what you can!"

sentence1: Hurry home at once to arrange your affairs and save what you can!"
sentence2: Frightened, the man faced his horses about and drove home as fast as he could.

sentence1: Frightened, the man faced his horses about and drove home as fast as he could.
sentence2: All that he possessed in the way of treasures, clothes and jewels, he removed from the house.

sentence1: All that he possessed in the way of treasures, clothes and jewels, he removed from the house.
sentence2: Yet, thanks to the Fire-God, the man had saved all his movable belongings.
